qas.question: What did Obama say the US is at war with, in 2009?

answers.text: a far-reaching network of violence and hatred

qas.question: What was the "Global War on Terror" officially renamed to in March 2009?
What term did Obama want the government to stop using?
Who said in 2012 that the fight would change from military to law enforcement?
What was the  "Overseas Contingency Operations" renamed to in 2010?
What did Barack Obama change the name of "Global War on Terror' to?
What is the OOC also known as?
Who spoke at Oxford University in December of 2013?
Who defined the goal in a speech in May of 2012?
What year was "Overseas Contingency Operations" changed to "Violent Extremism Countering?"
What was the Overseas Contingency Operation renamed as in 2009?

plausible_answers.text: U.S. Office of Management and Budget

qas.question: What did the Defense Department change its name to?
What university did Jeh Johnson work for?
What did Obama say the military fight would be replaced with?
Who did Pentagon staff members request to avoid the term war on terror?

context: U.S. President Barack Obama has rarely used the term, but in his inaugural address on 20 January 2009, he stated "Our nation is at war, against <a0_0>a far-reaching network of violence and hatred<a0_0/>." In March 2009 the Defense Department officially changed the name of operations from "<b10_0>Global War on Terror<b10_0/>" to "<a1_0><b5_0><b6_0>Overseas Contingency Operation<b6_0/><b5_0/><a1_0/>" (OCO). In March 2009, <b14_0>the Obama administration<b14_0/> requested that Pentagon staff members avoid use of the term, instead using "Overseas Contingency Operation". Basic objectives of the Bush administration "<a2_0>war on terror<a2_0/>", such as targeting al Qaeda and building international counterterrorism alliances, remain in place. In December 2012, <a3_0><b7_0>Jeh Johnson<b7_0/><a3_0/>, the General Counsel of the Department of Defense, stated that the military fight will be replaced by a <b13_0>law enforcement operation<b13_0/> when speaking at <b12_0>Oxford<b12_0/> University, predicting that al Qaeda will be so weakened to be ineffective, and has been "effectively destroyed", and thus the conflict will not be an armed conflict under international law. In May 2013, <b8_0>Obama<b8_0/> stated that the goal is "to dismantle specific networks of violent extremists that threaten America"; which coincided with the <b11_0>U.S. Office of Management and Budget<b11_0/> having changed the wording from "Overseas Contingency Operations" to "<a4_0>Countering Violent Extremism<a4_0/>" in <b9_0>2010<b9_0/>.
